message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to show you this amazing product. I think it's worth a lot to you, and I'm willing to offer it to you for $250.
I'm really interested in the product, but $250 is a bit out of my budget. I was thinking more along the lines of $180. Can you meet me at that price?

I understand that $250 is a bit steep for you, but I still think the product is worth a premium. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $220. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really benefit from this product.
I appreciate the willingness to meet me halfway, but $220 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay $190 for the product. Can you consider that price?

I understand that you're trying to get the best deal, and I appreciate your persistence. However, I think the product is worth more than $190. I'm willing to compromise and offer it to you for $200. It's a great price, and I think you'll really benefit from this product.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $200 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay $180, and that's my final offer. If you can meet me at that price, I'd be happy to make a deal.

I understand that you're trying to get the best deal, and I appreciate your persistence. However, I think the product is worth more than $180. I'm willing to make one more compromise and offer it to you for $195. It's a great price, and I think you'll really benefit from this product.

I've already made it clear that I'm willing to pay $180 for the product. I'm not willing to go any higher than that. If you're not willing to meet me at that price, I'll have to consider other options.

I understand that you're firm on the price, but I'm not willing to sell the product for $180. I'm willing to make one more compromise and offer it to you for $185. It's a great price, and I think you'll really benefit from this product.
